Posts.Content: keetmom wrote: I am a 42 year old mom of 3. My youngest has a genetic disorder called neurofibromatosis, I also have it.Â  We have spent much of the past 5 years doing surgery after surgery and chemo after chemo on her...for multiple brain tumors.Â  She also has had a leg amputated and just recently spinal rodding/fusion. So as you see I have been quiet busy.Â  Finally recently after 4 years I scheduled a physical and went in and the Dr felt one breast felt thicker then the other...scheduled mamogram for a few weeks later because of the spinal fusion my daughter had scheduled...well had the mamo, then a sterographic (hope I have the name right) biopsy and they called yesterday and said that the biopsy contains the earliest breast cancer they can diagnose (thinking that that means DCIS---I think he said something about the ducts)Â  we are meeting the surgeon on Friday and will figure out how to procede...I just wish our family could catch a break...it has been a long string of bad news in our house... I don't know if with my NF1 I can do radiation with out opening myself up to secondary cancers.....so Im not sure what we will do...but I guess we need to meet the doctor first.
